description: Adrian Mannarino of France won the ATP 250 Sofia Open here on Saturday after beating Jack Draper of Britain 7-6 (6), 2-6, 6-3 in the final. Participat.....
maintext:
SOFIA, Nov. 11 (Xinhua) -- Adrian Mannarino of France won the ATP 250 Sofia Open here on Saturday after beating Jack Draper of Britain 7-6 (6), 2-6, 6-3 in the final.
Participating in the tournament for the seventh time, the second-seeded Frenchman lifted his third ATP title of the season and fifth in career after a battle lasting two hours and 17 minutes.
35-year-old Mannarino, who started the tournament as No. 25 in the world, will rise to a career-high No. 20 in the ATP rankings.
"That's definitely the best way to finish the year," Mannarino said post-match. "It's been a great year and I'm a little bit exhausted but it's really motivating when you're doing well. I was playing great on court and I'm happy with the result," he said.
"I don't know what made the difference today, but it's like this. Sometimes you win, sometimes you lose, and I'm just a little bit luckier today," Mannarino said.
title: Mannarino wins ATP Sofia Open
